quotes: source:[Developers Q&A December 2022 - January 2023](https://universe.flyff.com/news/qna-01-2023 "Developers Q&A December 2022 - January 2023")

source:[Flyff Universe Developer Q&A December â€˜22 - January â€˜23 Questions](https://wcdn-universe.flyff.com/site/qna_01_2023.pdf "Flyff Universe Developer Q&A December â€˜22 - January â€˜23 Questions")

items.content: When you fight monsters much lower than your level you have a reduced drop rate, and when de-leveling the game treats your character as your **highest level** from a drop penalty perspective.

content.content: If you're considering intentionally reducing your level to farm more efficiently, please remember that these mechanisms will affect your drop rates.

quotes: source:[@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)](https://discord.com/channels/778915844070834186/1000058902576119878/1124117122432380958 "@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)")

items.content: Drop rate is based on the character with the **highest level** who is **participating**.

content.content: As an example, if a 126 and 140 kill an Ancient Mammoth (level 139), the highest level player who contributed is taken into account. That means the experience would be reduced by 20% for both players, and both players would have a full 100% drop rate.

quotes: source:[@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)](https://discord.com/channels/778915844070834186/1000058902576119878/1113470252257382550 "@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)")
quotes_cn: æ¥æº:[@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)](https://discord.com/channels/778915844070834186/1000058902576119878/1113470252257382550 "@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)")

content.content: *Healing and Resurrection are not considered participation, but Tanking, Holycross, and any attack that causes damage are considered participation.*
*The penalties still apply if the monster's HP has not fully recovered, regardless of whether the highest-level character has disconnected, switched to another channel or world, or died.*

*High level players will not negatively affect the drop rate of monsters for lower level players by receiving damage from special attacks of giants or violet monsters.* You don't affect the drop rate if the AoE damage you receive comes from a monster that you can't attack back (not the same party etc.)

quotes: source:[Minor Fixes after 11/21 Maintenance](https://universe.flyff.com/news/minorfixesnov21 "Minor Fixes after 11/21 Maintenance")
quotes_cn: æ¥æº:[Minor Fixes after 11/21 Maintenance](https://universe.flyff.com/news/minorfixesnov21 "Minor Fixes after 11/21 Maintenance")

items.content: Player level does not affect the drop rate of **monster cosmetics**; players may farm cosmetics effectively at any level.

quotes: source:[@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)](https://discord.com/channels/778915844070834186/1000058902576119878/1092833498034880552 "@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)")
quotes_cn: æ¥æº:[@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)](https://discord.com/channels/778915844070834186/1000058902576119878/1092833498034880552 "@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)")

items.content: If any of the participants has an active Optional Master/Hero Quest, the drop rate is divided by 2 (**50% drop rate penalty**).

Character Buffs That Increase Drop Rate.title: Character Buffs That Increase Drop Rate

items.content: Regarding Party Skills(Lucky Drop and Gift Box), Housing Buffs, Adventurer's Fortune Flask, and other character buffs that increase drop rates:

content.content: When a monster dies, the drop rate is affected by the buffs of the character who dealt the **most total damage**, and the drops will belong to that character, ignoring players who are disconnected, have switched to another channel or world, or are dead.
*The **last hit** is only considered for monster kill count like quests, battle pass, achievement etc.*
If there are two characters with the same total damage, the character who started attacking the monster last will affect it (this is not about the last hit but rather the order of the first hit).
If a character dies and then resurrects, the total damage dealt by the character does **not** include the damage done before death.

items.content: Drops are all done in a separate drop groups, so big loot tables don't affect the ability for certain things to drop (like cards, sunstones, unique weapons, etc.)

quotes: source:[@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)](https://discord.com/channels/778915844070834186/1172687169337430116/1172969789002616993 "@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)")
quotes_cn: æ¥æº:[@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)](https://discord.com/channels/778915844070834186/1172687169337430116/1172969789002616993 "@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)")

items.content: There are different drop groups on each monster so when killed the monster will drop a set amount of items from each group based on the drop chance.

quotes: source:[@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)](https://discord.com/channels/778915844070834186/1076577555546656850/1171954949765222470 "@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)")
quotes_cn: æ¥æº:[@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)](https://discord.com/channels/778915844070834186/1076577555546656850/1171954949765222470 "@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)")

items.content: For instance if you kill a violet in Darkon 3, it will check the scrolls group 5 times and give you either a spro low, a spro, an apro, or a gpro, with probability affected by drop skills, level, etc.

source:[@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)](https://discord.com/channels/778915844070834186/1076577555546656850/1171955221300252783 "@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)")
quotes_cn: æ¥æº:[@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)](https://discord.com/channels/778915844070834186/1076577555546656850/1171955221300252783 "@bluechromed @[Dev] Blukie (discord flyff universe)")

items.content: When a monster dies, it will always check the drop table in order, starting with the items that have the **lowest chances first**, which means that the rarest items are rolled first.

We received many feedbacks regarding the disadvantage of players using a 1vs1 playstyle. It takes them more time to level up and loot items due to the ability of AoE players to kill more monsters at a time.

content.content: Thus we introduced a new mechanism to the game: low, regular and captain monsters level 30+ killed by **at least 80% of damage inflicted from single target attacks and skills** will have an increased experience and drop rate.

items.content: The 1v1 experience and drop rate increase is currently **20%** for monsters at level 30 and gradually rises to **35%** at level 140, with rates ranging from **90%** at level 141 to **102%** at level 160.

**The 1v1 experience and drop rate increases are based on monster level**, which means that you can take advantage of these increases as soon as you are strong enough to fight monsters at level 141 and above.

When a single player enters general instance dungeons (Big Muscle, Krrr, Mushmoot, Iblis Leanes, Clockworks War, Meteonyker, Red Meteonyker), there will be a drop penalty of -68% to -90% (applicable when there is only 1 player).

The monsters in these **6 new dungeons** (Leren Chasm, è±æ–¯ Catacombs, Envy Depths, Guardian Sanctuary, Storm Peak, The Wilds) have no level. They are balanced according to the required entry level, but they do not interact the same way as other monsters in terms of level difference penalties.

content.content: The monsters do not have any damage reduction based on level difference, so their damage is not affected by your level at all. They also have no drop penalties based on level difference, so it doesn't matter what level you are - if you can enter the dungeon, you have the full drop rate potential.

items.content: Some dungeon curses grant extra drop rate for all monsters inside the dungeon, ranging from as low as 1% to as high as 10%.
If you find and kill the **Golden Aibatt** in dungeons, the last super monster will feel generous and will have an increased drop and EXP bonus of 10%.
